body_html: So I am actually trying to point out the opposite. When output_projection = None, then num_decoder_symbols should not be ignored and the outputs should be a list of outputs with shape [batch_size x num_decoder_symbols], but what is actually happening is that with output_projection = None the outputs are coming out as [batch_size x cell.output_size] so I am actually being forced to pass the variables to the dense layer myself. I would like to not have to use output_projection if it can be avoided, but it seems there is no way to avoid it at the moment.

body: So I am actually trying to point out the opposite.  When output_projection = None, then num_decoder_symbols should not be ignored and the outputs should be a list of outputs with shape [batch_size x num_decoder_symbols], but what is actually happening is that with output_projection = None the outputs are coming out as [batch_size x cell.output_size] so I am actually being forced to pass the variables to the dense layer myself.  I would like to not have to use output_projection if it can be avoided, but it seems there is no way to avoid it at the moment.
